displaytitle: The Banquet of Antony and Cleopatra
medium: Pen and brown ink and brush and brown wash
creditline: Bequest of the Joseph F. McCrindle Collection
markings:
Stamp in black ink, lower left (partially abraded): [Lugt 2662]
Recto, lower left, in black (partially abraded): WYO [mongram] (Lugt. 2662) (See reference Bib. 4661)
inscribed:
Inscribed in brown ink, along lower edge: m. antonio invita acena la cleopatra essendo r. cleopatra il dis (…) di m. antonio della (…) medesima (?) dell; 
Inscribed in graphite, lower right center: Ottley’s mark
Inscribed in brown ink, on verso of mount, lower left center: D. 28
Inscribed in graphite, on verso of mount lower left center: Nicolas Poussin

titles.title: The Banquet of Antony and Cleopatra

texts.textentryhtml: William Young Ottley; Este Gallery, New York (as “French, seventeenth century”); purchased in 1958 by Joseph F. McCrindle;

bibliography.boilertext: "Acquisitions of the Princeton University Art Museum 2008," Record of the Princeton University Art Museum 68 (2009): p. 69-119.
bibliography.citation: "Acquisitions of the Princeton University Art Museum 2008," Record of the Princeton University Art Museum 68 (2009): p. 69-119., p. 77 (illus.)

bibliography.boilertext: Frits Lugt, Les marques de collections de dessins & d'estampes: marques estampillées et écrites de collections particulières et publiques: marques de marchands, de monteurs et d'imprimeurs: cachets de vente d'artistes décédés: marques de graveurs apposées après le tirage des planches : timbres d'édition, etc., (Amsterdam: Vereenigde drukkerijen; La Haye: Nijhoff, 1921).
bibliography.citation: Frits Lugt, Les marques de collections de dessins & d'estampes: marques estampillées et écrites de collections particulières et publiques: marques de marchands, de monteurs et d'imprimeurs: cachets de vente d'artistes décédés: marques de graveurs apposées après le tirage des planches : timbres d'édition, etc., (Amsterdam: Vereenigde drukkerijen; La Haye: Nijhoff, 1921)., Lugt no. 2662

caption: Francesco Allegrini (Italian, 1615/1620 - after 1679), The Banquet of Antony and Cleopatra. Pen and brown ink and brush and brown wash; 10 × 18.7 cm (sheet), 24.8 x 33 cm (frame). Bequest of the Joseph F. McCrindle Collection (2008-361)
